Submodules¶

pyecg.beat_info module¶

This file is part of a personal project and is copyrighted.If you have gained access to this file, please delete it and inform the owner by this email: sadegh0@gmail.com

class pyecg.beat_info.BeatInfo(fs=360, beat_loc=10, in_ms=True)[source]¶

Bases: object

Computes features for a single beat.

data: dict
key=’rpeaks’

A list containing locations of rpeaks.

key=’waveform’

Waveform of the beat.

key=’start_idxs’

Index of beginnig of the segmented waveform in the original signal.

fs: int

Sampling rate

bloc: int

Index of the beat in the rpeaks list, considering pre-RR and post-RR values.

in_ms: bool

Whether to calculate rr-intervals in time(miliseconds) or samples.

waveformlist

Whole waveform.

bwaveformlist

Beat waveform. Selected as a segment of whole waveform.

start_idx: int

The index of the first sample of the waveform according to the original signal.

rrilist

RR intervals in ms if in_ms=True.

rri_smpllist

RR intervals in samples.

sdrrilist

Successive RRI differences.

start_idx

Bases: Sequence

data is a 2d list.

[[signal1, full_ann1],[signal2, full_ann2],…]

only the signal parts are used.

samples_info is a 2d list.

[[index,record_no,start_win,end_win,label],[index,record_no,start_win,end_win,label], …] eg: [[1,10,500,800,’AFIB’],[],…]

pyecg.data_arrhythmia.full_annotate_arr(record)[source]¶

Fully annotate a single recorded signal.

Parameters:

record – A dictionary with keys: signal,r_locations, r_labels,rhythms,rhythms_locations

Returns:

A 2d list–>[signal, full_ann]. First dim is the original signal. Second dim is a list that has the same size as the input signal with elements as the arrhythmia class at each index like: [‘(N’,’(N’,’(N’,’(N’,’AFIB’,’AFIB’,’AFIB’,…]

pyecg.data_arrhythmia.get_all_annotated_records(rec_list)[source]¶
Parameters:

rec_list – List of records.

Returns:

A list containing a dict for each record. [rec1,rec2,….]. Each rec is a dictionary with keys:

signal, full_ann, r_locations, r_labels,rhythms,rhythms_locations.

pyecg.data_arrhythmia.get_ecg_record(record_num=106)[source]¶
Returns:

signal, r_locations, r_labels, rhythms, rhythms_locations

Return type:

Signal and its annotations as a dictionary with keys

  • rec2 –

  • dictionary. (....]. Each rec is a) –

Returns: returns a 2d list. Each inner list: [index,record_no,start_win,end_win,label] [[record_no,start_win,end_win,label],[record_no,start_win,end_win,label], …] eg: [[10,500,800,’AFIB’],[],…]

pyecg.data_handling module¶

This file is part of a personal project and is copyrighted.If you have gained access to this file, please delete it and inform the owner by this email: sadegh0@gmail.com

class pyecg.data_handling.DataHandling(base_path='/media/ubuntu/usbdata/ecg/docs', data_path='mit-bih-arrhythmia-database-1.0.0/', win=[60, 120], remove_bl=True, lowpass=True, fs=360, cutoff=45, order=15)[source]¶

Bases: object

Method save_dataset creates a file containing signal fragments

and their corresponding label

Example

dh = DataHandling(base_path=’../data’) dh.save_dataset(records=DS2,save_file_name=’DS2.dat’) x_test, y_test = dh.load_data(load_file_name=’DS2.dat’) statReport = dh.report_stats_table([y_test],[‘test’])

Preprocesses raw signals .. rubric:: Example

dpr = STFT() features_train = dpr.specgram(x_train, Fs=360, nperseg=127, noverlap=122)

input: 2d array of raw signals output: 3d array of transformed signals

pyecg.data_preprocessing.remove_baseline(signal, fs=360)[source]¶

Applies two median filters to remove the baseline wander from the signal inputs:

signal: a 1d numpy array fs:sampling frequency

output: a 1d array having the same shape as the input signal

pyecg.data_rpeak module¶

This file is part of a personal project and is copyrighted.If you have gained access to this file, please delete it and inform the owner by this email: sadegh0@gmail.com

class pyecg.data_rpeak.ECGSequence(data, samples_info, batch_size, binary=True, raw=False, interval=36, class_labels=None, shuffle=True)[source]¶

Bases: Sequence

Parameters:

  • data –

    is a 2d list.

    [[signal1, full_ann1],[signal2, full_ann2],…]

    only the signal parts are used.

  • samples_info – is a 2d list. [[record_no,start_win,end_win,label],[record_no,start_win,end_win,[labels] ], …] eg: [[10,500,800,[0,0,0,’N’,0,0…],[],…]

  • raw – boolean. Whether to return the full waveform or the computed features.

  • interval – int. interval for sub segmenting the waveform for feature and label computations.

  • class_labels – list or None. the list of class labels to convert the output label list to integers.

Returns:

2d array of (batch,segments,features) (batch_size, 300, 2) batch_y: 2d array of (batch,label_list) (batch_size, 300)

Return type:

batch_x

get_binary(label)[source]¶
get_integer(label)[source]¶
get_label(seg)[source]¶
on_epoch_end()[source]¶

Method called at the end of every epoch.

proc_steps(seq)[source]¶
pyecg.data_rpeak.full_annotate_rpeak(record)[source]¶

fully annotate a single recorded signal. :param record = a dictionary.: keys: signal,r_locations,r_labels,rhythms,rhythms_locations

Returns:

a list of zeros. At any index with an rpeak the zero is changed to label. [00000N00000000000000L00000…]

pyecg.data_rpeak.get_all_annotated_records(rec_list)[source]¶
Returns:

a list containing [signal, full_ann] for all records in rec_list

[[signal1, full_ann1],[signal2, full_ann2],…]

pyecg.data_rpeak.get_ecg_record(record_num=106)[source]¶

return the signal and annotations as a dictionary keys: signal,r_locations,r_labels,rhythms,rhythms_locations

pyecg.data_rpeak.make_samples_info(annotated_records, win_size=10800, stride=256, interval=128, binary=True)[source]¶
Parameters:

  • annotated_records – [[signal1, full_ann1],[signal2, full_ann2],…]

  • win_size – the length of each extracted sample

  • stride – the stride for extracted samples.

  • interval – the output interval for labels.

  • binary – if True 1 is replaced instead of labels

Returns:

[record_no,start_win,end_win,label] [[record_no,start_win,end_win,label],[record_no,start_win,end_win,label], …] label is a list. Elements are rpeak labels for each interval. eg: [[10,500,800, [000000N00000000L00] ],[],…]

Return type:

a 2d list. Each inner list

pyecg.data_rpeak.save_samples_rpeak(rec_list, file_path, win_size, stride, interval, binary)[source]¶

class pyecg.data_rpeak.ECGSequence(data, samples_info, batch_size, binary=True, raw=False, interval=36, class_labels=None, shuffle=True)[source]¶

Bases: Sequence

Parameters:

  • data –

    is a 2d list.

    [[signal1, full_ann1],[signal2, full_ann2],…]

    only the signal parts are used.

  • samples_info – is a 2d list. [[record_no,start_win,end_win,label],[record_no,start_win,end_win,[labels] ], …] eg: [[10,500,800,[0,0,0,’N’,0,0…],[],…]

  • raw – boolean. Whether to return the full waveform or the computed features.

  • interval – int. interval for sub segmenting the waveform for feature and label computations.

  • class_labels – list or None. the list of class labels to convert the output label list to integers.

Returns:

2d array of (batch,segments,features) (batch_size, 300, 2) batch_y: 2d array of (batch,label_list) (batch_size, 300)

Return type:

batch_x

  • stride – the stride for extracted samples.

  • interval – the output interval for labels.

  • binary – if True 1 is replaced instead of labels

Returns:

[record_no,start_win,end_win,label] [[record_no,start_win,end_win,label],[record_no,start_win,end_win,label], …] label is a list. Elements are rpeak labels for each interval. eg: [[10,500,800, [000000N00000000L00] ],[],…]

pyecg.features module¶

This file is part of a personal project and is copyrighted.If you have gained access to this file, please delete it and inform the owner by this email: sadegh0@gmail.com

pyecg.features.get_hrv_features(rri, features='all')[source]¶

Computes hrv features for the input samples.

Parameters:

  • rri (2D numpy.array) – A 2D numpy array with shape (#samples,len_series). Series are rr intervals in miliseconds(ms)

  • features (list) – A list of features to be computed.

Returns:

features_arr – A 2D numpy array with the shape (#samples, #features).

Return type:

2D numpy.array

pyecg.features.get_stat_features(data, features='all')[source]¶

Computes statistical features for the input samples.

Parameters:

  • data (2D numpy.array) – A 2D numpy array with shape (#samples,len_series).

  • features (list) – A list of features to be computed.

Returns:

features_arr – A 2D numpy array with the shape (#samples, #features).

Return type:

2D numpy.array
